alert.note: Alert for Berks (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 11 at 5:22AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of east central Pennsylvania, including the following county, Berks. * WHEN...Until 845 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 518 AM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing in the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - For Manatawny Creek at Spangville: At 4:15am the stage was 6.06 feet. Flood Stage is 6 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
